title: Strengthening Customer Service Practical Competencies: Pressure Injury Prevention Training for Elderly Care Providers

context.prior_knowledge: Basic elderly care techniques and foundational concepts of pressure ulcer management
context.additional_context: Service/Customer Engagement Role-Specific Competency Development Program

learning_goals: Learners can accurately identify and explain five risk factors for pressure ulcer development.
Learners can perform specific action procedures for pressure injury prevention, such as repositioning every 2 hours.
Learners can develop preventive care plans using nutritional assessment and skin care documentation systems.
Learners can utilize educational materials aligned with SAM evaluation criteria to instruct peer caregivers.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
